required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison Study of Oxybutynin and Botulinum Toxin for Neurogenic Detrusor Overactivity
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison Study of Oxybutynin and Botulinum Toxin for Neurogenic Detrusor Overactivity

lead_sponsor.agency: Centro de Reabilitação e Readaptação Dr. Henrique Santillo

clinical_study.source: Centro de Reabilitação e Readaptação Dr. Henrique Santillo

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effects of oral oxybutynin and intradetrusor injections of botulinum toxin type A on urodynamic parameters and quality of life in patients with neurogenic detrusor overactivity following spinal cord injury.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary study outcome measure was the variation mean in the number of episodes of urinary incontinence per 24 hours, maximum cystometric capacity, maximum detrusor pressure and bladder compliance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Beginning and 24 weeks of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: The secondary outcome measure was quality of life as measured by the Qualiveen questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Beginning and 24 weeks of the study

intervention.description: 5 mg of immediate-release oxybutynin orally 3 times daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Spinal cord injury
- Detrusor overactivity
- Age over 18 years
- Spinal cord injury at least 12 months duration
- Undergoing regular clean intermittent catheterisation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Desire to become pregnant during the study period
- Breastfeeding
- Blood coagulation disorder
- Neuromuscular transmission disorder
- Use of any intravesical pharmacologic agents
- Previous use of botulinum toxin A

overall_official.affiliation: Division of Urology of State University of Campinas, Division of Urology of Centro de Reabilitaçao e Readapatacao Dr. Henrique Santillo

reference.citation: Karsenty G, Denys P, Amarenco G, De Seze M, Gamé X, Haab F, Kerdraon J, Perrouin-Verbe B, Ruffion A, Saussine C, Soler JM, Schurch B, Chartier-Kastler E. Botulinum toxin A (Botox) intradetrusor injections in adults with neurogenic detrusor overactivity/neurogenic overactive bladder: a systematic literature review. Eur Urol. 2008 Feb;53(2):275-87. Epub 2007 Oct 16. Review.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centro de Reabilitação e Readaptação Dr. Henrique Santillo
